document.docAuthor: Monné, Marcela Laura & Solange Napp, Dilma
document.masterDocTitle: New South American Genus and Species, and Notes on Xenambyx lansbergei (Thomson) (Coleoptera: Cerambycidae: Cerambycinae: Torneutini)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New South American Genus and Species, and Notes on Xenambyx lansbergei (Thomson) (Coleoptera: Cerambycidae: Cerambycinae: Torneutini)

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Xenambyx laticauda Bates 1879: 14
; Martins & Monné 1980: 337 ( syn. ).

Xenambyx laticauda meridionalis Franz 1954: 216
; Martins & Monné 1980:337 ( syn. ).

Xenambyx lansbergei laticauda
; Martins & Monné 1980: 337;
Monné 1994: 2
(cat.).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Torneutes lansbergei
was described by Thomson (1865) based on a single female specimen from Surinam .

Bates (1879) proposed the monotypic genus
Xenambyx
, with
X. laticauda Bates, 1879
, also based on one specimen , probably female, from Guatemala .

Franz (1954) described
Xenambyx laticauda meridionalis
based on specimens collected in Brazil ( type locality: Mato Grosso )
, Colombia , and Venezuela .

Martins and Monné (1980) transferred
Torneutes lansbergei Thomson
to
Xenambyx
and, at the same time, considered
Xenambyx laticauda Bates
and
Xenambyx laticauda meridionalis Franz
as its junior synonyms. They also commented that possibly two subspecies could be considered:
X. lansbergei lanbergei
and
X. lansbergei laticauda
.

Monné (1994) recorded two subspecies:
Xenambyx lansbergei lanbergei ( Thomson, 1865 )
and
Xenambyx lansbergei laticauda Bates, 1879
.

The examination of more material together with color photographs of Thomson’s (MNHN) ( Fig. 2 ) and Bates’ (BMNH) ( Fig. 3 ) type specimens, led us to consider that the subspecies are mere variations within the species without geographic distinction.
Distribution. Guatemala , El Salvador , Costa Rica , Panama´, Colombia , Venezuela , Guyana , Surinam , Peru , Bolivia , Brazil .
